edu.umd.cs.guitar.ripper

Class Ripper

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umd.cs.guitar.ripper.Ripper

  • public class Ripper
extends java.lang.Object
    The core ripping algorithm implementation. Exceptions encountered during the ripping processes are propagated up from the lower level as high as possible. Ideally, the execute() method should propagate it upwards. As of now, the execute() function is as far as the exceptions propagate. Exceptions caused by GUITAR state errors are thrown as RipperStateException. All other exceptions are caused by the AUT.

    Author:
    Bao Nguyen

    • Field Detail

      • GUITAR_RIPPER_PRINT_COMP_INFO_FLAG

        public static final java.lang.String GUITAR_RIPPER_PRINT_COMP_INFO_FLAG
        Flag to print out the component information during ripping. information is used for debugging and create the ripper configuration file.

        This feature is off by default. Turn on it by adding -Dguitar.ripper.printCompInfo to the command-line java call.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Entry point for beginning the ripping process. The ripping process generates the .GUI file and other artifacts (if any) in the strDataPath directory. Exceptions propagate up to this method as of now. Ideally, this method must propagate it to the caller.
